eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Recolorizer
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Independently change the colors of a sprite, a tiled sprite or a panel sprite.
description: This extension allows to restyle a sprite, a tiled sprite or a panel sprite.
It can be used to:
- Change the color of player short according to its team color.
- Add small color variation to trees of a forest.
- Restyle objects to match other assets.
An example shows how to change the 2 main colors of an object ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://recolorizer)).
This extension is experimental and might no longer work in future version of GDevelop.

eventsFunctions.description: Define JavaScript classes.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineJavaScript

inlineCode: * Converts an HSL color value to RGB. Conversion formula
* Assumes h, s, and l are contained in the set [0, 1] and
* returns r, g, and b in the set [0, 255].
const q = l < 0.5 ? l * (1 + s) : l + s - l * s;
* Converts an RGB color value to HSL. Conversion formula
* Assumes r, g, and b are contained in the set [0, 255] and
* returns h, s, and l in the set [0, 1].
const max = Math.max(r, g, b), min = Math.min(r, g, b);
s = l > 0.5 ? d / (2 - max - min) : d / (max + min);
case r: h = (g - b) / d + (g < b ? 6 : 0); break;
case g: h = (b - r) / d + 2; break;
case b: h = (r - g) / d + 4; break;
* Replace a color with an other one.
* @param {{x: number, y: number, width: number, height: number}} frame
* @param {[number, number, number]} originColor The color to replace from.
* @param {[number, number, number]} targetColor The color to replate to.
* @param {number} hueScope Pixels within the hue scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} saturationScope Pixels within the saturation scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} lighnessScope Pixels within the lightness scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
function recolorizeTexture(sourceCanvas, targetCanvas, frame, originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope) {
// hue is not knowned for graycase colors.
// graycase pixels must take the targeted hue
pixelHsl[0] = pixelSaturation === 0 ? targetHue : gdjs.evtTools.common.mod(pixelHue - originHue + targetHue, 1);
// white pixels must also take the targeted saturation.
* @param {[number, number, number]} originColor The color to replace from.
* @param {[number, number, number]} targetColor The color to replate to.
* @param {number} hueScope Pixels within the hue scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} saturationScope Pixels within the saturation scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} lighnessScope Pixels within the lightness scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
function getRecolorizationKey(originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope) {
* Manage recolorizations to ensure uniqueness of textures.
* Register a recolorization usage and get recolored textures.
* @param {Array<{originColor: [number, number, number], targetColor: [number, number, number], hueScope: number, saturationScope: number, lighnessScope: number}>} recolorizations
recolorizedSprite = { userCount: 0, textures: targetTextures, canvas: targetCanvas };
* Apply a recoloration to every textures.
* @param {Array<{originColor: [number, number, number], targetColor: [number, number, number], hueScope: number, saturationScope: number, lighnessScope: number}>} recolorizations
/** @type {Array<{originColor: [number, number, number], targetColor: [number, number, number], hueScope: number, saturationScope: number, lighnessScope: number}>} */
* Replace a color with an other one.
* @param {[number, number, number]} originColor The color to replace from.
* @param {[number, number, number]} targetColor The color to replate to.
* @param {number} hueScope Pixels within the hue scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} saturationScope Pixels within the saturation scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} lighnessScope Pixels within the lightness scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
this.recolorizationKey += getRecolorizationKey(originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope);
this.recolorizations.push({ originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope});
* Reset the default textures of the object.
* Update the textures of the object.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.

parameters.description: Object
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Object
parameters.name: Object

events.comment: Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: References
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds references and pointers for variables.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Adds actions to use references (variable that redirect any read/write to another variable) and pointers (unique numbers identifying a variable that can be resolved to a reference). Some usages are for callback variables in events based functions (getting a variable with a fixed name referring to a variable with a name passed as parameter), pointers to make advanced data structures like linked lists, and getting a top level variable dynamically.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ArrayTools
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A collection of utilities and tools for working with arrays.
description: This extension adds features like:
- Combining arrays (concatenate into new array, append all children to another array)
- Finding a value in an array (find index expression, contains condition)
- Reversing arrays
- Get a portion of an array (slice)
- Add and remove lots of children at specific indices at once (fill, splice, shift, pop, add at index)
- Randomness (shuffle children, get a random child)
- Mathematical operations using arrays (sum of all numbers, biggest/smallest number, average number, median number)
- Sort numbers in an array
- String inter-operation (split string into array, join array array children to string)
Breaking changes from 3.0.0
- Variables have to be declared

inlineCode: // Ensure the target is a clean new array

parameters.description: The index to end the slice at
parameters.longDescription:
Set to 0 to copy all of the array. If you use a negative value, the index will be selected beginning from the end.  
For example, slicing an array with 5 elements from 0 to -1 would take only elements from indices 0 to 3.
parameters.name: End

eventsFunctions.description: Replaces all arrays inside of an array with their children. For example, [[1,2], [3,4]] becomes [1,2,3,4].
eventsFunctions.name: Flatten

inlineCode: // Cast to array to ensure getAllChildrenArray returns the real array
// At the position of the array (i), remove 1 element (the array),
// and insert elements of b (the contents of the array) in-place of the array.
// Skip over the elements that were just added as we are flattening only 1 level deep
// If deep, the current element has been replaced with another, we need to recheck it on next iteration.
// If not deep, the current element is now the one after the array elements and needs to be checked too.
// In both case, decreasing by 1 is necessary.

parameters.description: The array to flatten
parameters.name: Array

parameters.description: Deeply flatten
parameters.longDescription: If yes, will continue flattening until there is no arrays in the array anymore.
parameters.name: Deep

inlineCode: // Cast to array to ensure getAllChildrenArray returns the real array

// If not deep, the current element is now the one after the array elements and needs to be checked too.
// In both case, decreasing by 1 is necessary.
